intro: Hieracium intybellifolium, commonly known as the broad-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and it produces small, smooth, ribbed seeds. Hieracium intybellifolium is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
